entries.content: The purpose of the sales meeting is to diagnose if the prospect's problem is big enough to justify giving you the money to fix it.
entries.notes: Frames the sales meeting around value justification (ROI).

entries.content: Generate emotional feeling about the prospect's problem; this helps justify the cost of the solution later.
entries.notes: Creating pain/emotion is foundational to demonstrating the value (ROI) of the fix.

entries.content: Avoid showing irrelevant features in demos. Showing things the prospect doesn't need makes the price seem too high for the value they perceive.
entries.notes: Relates to justifying price by focusing on relevant value, avoiding perceived overspending.

entries.content: Discounting is often a sign that the salesperson cannot justify the value at the full price.
entries.notes: Implicitly promotes justifying price through value rather than reducing it.

focus_area: Handling Price Objections: Reframe to ROI, "Compared to what?", breakdown strategy
